diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia due to C562Y calcium-sensing receptor mutation and coexisting parathyroid adenoma
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was confirmed through clinical, biochemical, and genetic examinations. The patient presented with severe hypercalcemia, a high S-PTH level, low urinary calcium excretion, and a C562Y mutation in the CaSR gene. The Ca/Cr ratio below 0.01 further indicated familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia, despite the presence of a parathyroid adenoma.
